  • java.lang.Object

      • getGovernmentPayer

        public static Payer getGovernmentPayer(java.lang.String governmentPayerName)
        Returns the government payer with the given name.
        Parameters:
        governmentPayerName - the government payer to get.
        Returns:
        returns null if the government payer does not exist.

      • clear

        public static void clear()
        Clear the list of loaded and cached Payers. Currently only used in tests.

      • findPlan

        public static InsurancePlan findPlan(Person person,
                                     HealthRecord.EncounterType service,
                                     long time)
        Returns a Payer that the person can qualify for.
        Parameters:
        person - the person who needs to find insurance.
        service - the EncounterType the person would like covered.
        time - the time that the person requires insurance.
        Returns:
        a payer who the person can accept and vice versa.

      • getActivePlans

        public static java.util.Set<InsurancePlan> getActivePlans(java.util.Set<Payer> payers,
                                                          long time)
        Returns all active plans in the given payers based on the given time.
        Parameters:
        payers - The payers.
        time - The time for the plan to be active in.
        Returns:
        The set of active plans.

      • getNoInsurancePlan

        Returns:

      • findMedicareSupplement

        public static InsurancePlan findMedicareSupplement(Person person,
                                                   HealthRecord.EncounterType service,
                                                   long time)
        Finds an eligible medicare supplement plan for the given person.
        Parameters:
        person - The person for whom to find a medicare supplement plan.
        service - The service the plan should cover.
        time - The time.
        Returns:
        A potential Medicare Supplement plan, if eligible and affordable.
